issues.description: The problem statement refers to a Bitmap implementation with a protected method `resize_buffer`, but the template repository contains only x86 assembly files (no Java classes or `resize_buffer` stub), and the solution repository likewise contains only ASM. Students cannot find or declare the required `resize_buffer` method in the template.
issues.suggested_fix: Include a Java source file (e.g. `Bitmap.java`) in the template with a stub for the `resize_buffer` method declared `protected`, so students have the correct class and method signature to implement.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a protected method `resize_buffer` as part of the Bitmap Implementation, but neither the template nor the solution repositories include any `resize_buffer` stub. Instead, students are presented only with assembler function stubs (e.g., `fix_add_asm`), making it impossible to map the `resize_buffer` requirement to the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a Bitmap implementation stub in the template (and solution) repository—e.g., a class or file with a protected `resize_buffer` method signature matching the problem statement—so students can directly locate and implement the required method.
